thread.title: WikiLeaks claims CIA targeted iPhones, Microsoft Windows and turned Samsung TVs into microphones as part of global hacking programme
thread.title_full: WikiLeaks claims CIA targeted iPhones, Microsoft Windows and turned Samsung TVs into microphones as part of global hacking programme

author: Rachel Bishop
title: WikiLeaks claims CIA targeted iPhones, Microsoft Windows and turned Samsung TVs into microphones as part of global hacking programme
text:
News WikiLeaks claims CIA targeted iPhones, Microsoft Windows and turned Samsung TVs into microphones as part of global hacking programme The first full part of Year Zero, comprises of 8,761 documents and files from an isolated, high-security network situated inside the CIA's Center for Cyber Intelligence, according to Julian Assange Share WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange (Photo: PA) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
WikiLeaks has claimed the CIA targeted iPhones, Microsoft Windows and turned Samsung TVs into microphones as part of global hacking programme. 
The secretive organisation is about to release a huge trove of confidential documents from the U.S. Central Intelligence Agency as part of its mysterious Year Zero series. 
The leak, code-named "Vault 7," is the "largest ever publication of confidential documents on the CIA," WikiLeaks said today. 
It says this is in retaliation to the CIA's global covert hacking program and exploits against a U.S. and European company products. 
It claims these include Apple's iPhone, Google's Android and Microsoft's Windows and even Samsung TVs, which it says "are turned into covert microphones." 
We'll be bringing you the very latest updates, pictures and video on this breaking news story.
